title: Shrimp in Garlic Sauce
introduction: Shrimp cooked in a garlicky butter sauce is a delightful dish often found in Italian-American restaurants. Known as 'shrimp scampi' in some circles, its roots are not traditionally Italian. The term 'scampi' actually refers to a type of shellfish similar to miniature lobsters, typically grilled with olive oil, parsley, and lemon. Regardless of its nomenclature or origins, shrimp in garlic sauce is undeniably delicious and best enjoyed with plenty of bread to soak up the flavorful sauce.
ingredients: 16 to 24 large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a large skillet, melt the butter with the olive oil over medium heat. Stir in the garlic. Cook until the garlic is lightly golden, about 2 minutes.

Turn up the heat to medium-high. Add the shrimp, and salt to taste. Cook 1 to 2 minutes, turn the shrimp once, and cook until they are just pink, about 1 to 2 minutes more. Stir in the parsley and lemon juice and cook 1 minute more. Serve hot.
